datasetContactAffiliation.value: University of California, Los Angeles. Social Science Data Archive

dsDescriptionValue.value:
The study addresses itself to three types of questions. 1) Attitudes toward particular groups, such as major opposition parties, army (army rule), popular government, etc; 2) how widespread are attitudes toward society and 3) what can be said about people who hold these attitudes. The sample consisted of 2014 respondents.

Note: Codebook describes 'R' as NA or sometimes DK but the actual dataset contains blanks rather than 'R'. Also questions P15 and P16 use '+' and '-' as data but will generate invalid character messages. Otherwise data looks good and numbers match the frequency even if the variable labels for 'R', '+' and '-' will not display.

publicationCitation.value:
1) Kothari, Rajni. "The Congress System in India." Asian Survey (1964): 1161-1173;

2) Brecher, Michael. "Succession in India 1967: the routinization of political change." Asian Survey (1967): 423-443.
